subject: Data
title: Amazon DynamoDB: The Cloud Database Revolution
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Amazon DynamoDB: The Cloud Database Revolution.

hook.text: During a 2004 holiday sale, Amazon's database crashed under load. They decided to build an uncrashable one.

buildup.text: Amazon's internal Dynamo paper (2007) described a database designed for guaranteed availability at any scale.

discovery.text: DynamoDB, the commercial version, automatically scales from one request per second to millions â€” no manual tuning.

twist.text: But DynamoDB requires you to plan access patterns upfront. Change your query needs later, and you might need a redesign.

climax.text: Cloud databases like DynamoDB shifted the industry from buying servers to renting capacity on demand.

punchline.text: A holiday crash led to a database that never crashes.

quiz.question: What motivated Amazon to create DynamoDB?
options: A holiday sale database crash that showed the need for guaranteed availability
